title: Is Red Wine Really Healthier Than White?
sub_head: Everybody seems to know that red wine is better for us than white wine. But is everybody right? Our wine columnist reviewed the research with medical experts to drill down to the actual science.
body:
AT THE END of a recent visit to my gastroenterologist, he handed me a list of prescribed foods. “What about wine?” I asked, noting its absence. “Red wine is good for you,” he said. “And white?” I inquired. “White wine is just alcohol,” he replied.
Many wine drinkers believe that my doctor is right. Indeed, just about every one of the friends whom I surveyed declared that red wine is healthier than white—though few could say why. But is red wine actually more healthful than white wine? And is either one truly healthy?
